definition: to support one's family (idiom)
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 傢伙|家伙[jia1 huo5]
to live/alive/living/work/workmanship
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: We work to make a living, supporting ourselves and families. But now it is different.
sentences.chinese: 我们工作纯粹只是为了养家活口，然而现在不同了。

sentences.english: She feels it her duty to support her family.
sentences.chinese: 她感到养家活口是她的责任。

sentences.english: She thought she would not be able to bear the load of bringing up her family alone.
sentences.chinese: 她认为她无法独自一人担负起养家活口的重任。

sentences.english: Women are now bearing the burden of being breadwinners.
sentences.chinese: 女性现在担负着养家活口的责任。

sentences.english: You will know how important money is when you became a breadwinner yourself.
sentences.chinese: 等你要养家活口的时候，你就知道钱的重要了。

sentences.english: The father must provide food and clothes for his family.
sentences.chinese: 那位父亲必须供给家里衣食，养家活口。

sentences.english: Being the sole breadwinner, Mr. B feels very bad about being laid off.
sentences.chinese: 先生是唯一养家活口的人，他被解雇感到十分难过。

sentences.english: There has always been the breadwinner father, in charge of the day is over money.
sentences.chinese: 一贯有父亲养家活口，掌管钱财的日子也就结束了。

sentences.english: Always have a father, was in charge of the money as breadwinners day was over.
sentences.chinese: 一向有父亲养家活口，掌管财帛的日子也就完毕了。

definition: to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
to scrape a meager living/to get by with difficulty
variant of 糊口[hu2 kou3]
to scrape a meager living/to get by with difficulty
variant of 糊口[hu2 kou3]
to make a hard living as unskilled laborer
to support a family/to raise a family
livelihood
to subsist/to eke out a living/to keep body and soul together
to seek one's livelihood/to work to support oneself/to earn a living
to earn a living
(coll.) job/work
to provide for/to keep (animals, a family etc)/to raise animals/to feed and clothe/support/the necessities of life/to give birth
to make money
lit. to eat off one's own strength (idiom)/fig. to stand on one's own feet/to earn one's own living
to live one's life/to make a living
to eke out a living/to live from hand to mouth/to drift aimlessly
to moonlight/side job
to have enough food and warm clothes/adequately provided
